page.title: 15A SHEPHERD'S DAY
page.content: John Hann is a shepherd. He works on the Belmont Estate,where he tends 416 ewes, 8 rams and 497 lambs (July 1985) The ewes are Scottish half breeds and the rams are Suffolks. During the lambing season (March- April) he can work 17 hours a day, and during the winter from 5am to 6pm to cope with Winter feeding.In the slack Summer period he usually works 8am to 5pm. He can then mend fences and do general maintainance work. Shearing is carried by contractors in June and the fleeces are sent to the wool growers at Ashford. The fat lambs are sold at Market when about one year old for about Â£40. The shepherd is responsible for the health and welfare of the sheep. He trims fleeces, gives medicines and trims hooves. He keeps two collie dogs for rounding up.
